website_summaries.verdict: While the 2016 Kindle isn't a huge improvement over its predecessor, it's a perfectly good e-reader with a clearly improved design and a big upgrade for the visually impaired.
pros: The most affordable Kindle gets a subtle but worthwhile design upgrade (it's slimmer, lighter and less angular) and adds Bluetooth audio for accessibility, so visually impaired readers can hear VoiceView audio

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with new kindle
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with my "new" kindle. My old one served me very well for years before the screen crumped. I had hoped to transfer the books - some of which were gifted or purchased from non -Amazon parties - to my "new" kindle. I was able to make the transfer but was unable to open them. In a chartoom exchange with an Amazon kindle service rep I was told only books obtained through Amazon can be accessed by my "new" kindle - unlike my "old" kindle. Thus I lost a series of books written by my son and purchased from Smashwords -a digital publishing outfit. I also lost other books gifted to me from non-Amazon sources. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: william a taylor

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after 3 weeks. Isn't nearly as well made as unit I've had for 3 years. I will be returning it for a refund. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard J. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: 1) Letters look crisper just like a real book 2) Device is slightly lighter which ...
customer_reviews.text: PROS The three reasons I bought this instead of the Paperwhite is because: 1) Letters look crisper just like a real book 2) Device is slightly lighter which is important to me when binge reading for +14 hours (Wheel of Time anyone? lol) 3) No backlight in E-reader because: a) white light inhibits sleep, b) reading with a bright foreground and dark background is bad for your eyes because the constant release and contraction of the iris muscles causes unrecoverable wear and tear. CONS - My cat gnawed the case and now it has beauty marks... why didn't it come with those already? - Does not sync with my car to read e-book over the speakers
customer_reviews.author: jasonmh

customer_reviews.title: Bad product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought Oct 2016 Like the size. Battery life ok Update Feb 9, 2017 kindle stopped working at the end of January. pages will not turn. Very upset. Worked for 3 months June 29, 2017 Bought a second 6" Kindle reader on Feb 13, 2017, this one stopped working June 28th, 2017....lasted 4 months. You can be sure I will not be buying another Kindle
customer_reviews.author: D. Causwell

customer_reviews.title: When I called customer service I was very pleased because I was told to send it back and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I have been unhappy with a Kindle. I have had several. This one would not hold a charge and the battery goes dead very quickly. When I called customer service I was very pleased because I was told to send it back and Amazon would send me a new one. Now they are saying it is going to be repaired and I have no idea how long that will take or how well the "repair" will hold up. I have spent lots of money with my Amazon Prime. I will now consider options.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Parish

customer_reviews.title: E reader > Books
customer_reviews.text: If, like me, you are confused if an e reader is a worthwhile investment or should you save a few $$ by just sticking to the books, I can help you with the confusion. Buy the e reader. Easy to carry, can hold thousands of books, and two of the most important reasons for me: 1. easier on the eyes as compared to a book 2. Dictionary Buy it, I say. This is coming from a person who loved to hoard books and was always opinionated about how nice the books smelled and how they are a trophy on your book shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Jay - R

customer_reviews.title: Battery drain when not using it is problematic for me
customer_reviews.text: It's OK for those eBooks I can't get from other vendors, but the battery life is not long enough in my opinion. I can finish an eBook and recharge the Kindle. When I start another eBook a week or so later, the charge is down to 50% or less of a full charge; I haven't even been using it. My 2 Sony readers (PRS-950 and TRS-T3) do not exhibit battery drain issues; I can go for MONTHS without using them and they still have full charges after they've been recharged and I'm not using them. I wouldn't recommend a Kindle to a friend due to significant battery drain when not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen, Meh!
customer_reviews.text: I preferred my earlier Kindle with the buttons on the edge. This one often jumps many pages ahead due to an accidental touch. A drop of water will cause unwanted input. To dry or wipe the screen, it must be turned off. Cats don't help either. Some inputs are faster because of the touch keyboard, but I just want to read books without hassles.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Lee Walker

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: Same look as the older models. I like how the store looks and navigation is easy. The touch screen on the other hand is very annoying. Its not like a normal touch-screen where it needs contact with skin literally anything touching the screen changes things. I have had it 1 week and had to change the font size back like 50 times because it will brudh up against something.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small size
customer_reviews.text: The size is great as it easily fits in my purse. This is my first touch screen kindle reader. I like the buttons better for changing pages than the touch. This kindle was purchased February 16 and now it has failed on May 2. I adjusted my rating of it today as a device should last longer than 2-months. . My old manual kindles are still doing good and one is more than 10 years old. Because they are old this touch screen was bought as a backup. Perhaps touch screens are just a bad design for kindles. It would be nice to have an option.
customer_reviews.author: Mj

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect to wi-fi
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th kindle and the worst to date. My last mysteriously stopped working 1 week after the warranty ended. I ordered a new one. This one came and has never connected to my wi-fi. Says wrong password, even though I am entering the correct password. Tried to fix on phone with customer service. restarted router tried a hundred things and was told to send it back for repair. Came back today and it is doing the exact same thing. Customer service wants the steps all repeated again, did that still won't connect. Now saying it is past return time even though I have never been able to use it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Toppa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and weight
customer_reviews.text: I have the Kindle Oasis but wanted something smaller and lighter without a built in light for on the go reading. This is perfect for what I wanted. The screen is not as crisp but the font is a bit bolder. The screen is also darker than the oasis even when the light on the oasis is turned off. But it’s not overly dark that i feel that i need a light in normal indoor setting.
customer_reviews.author: JayeP

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I really love this little Kindle that I purchased to replace my original Kindle that I lost a few months ago. I like this one much better than the original Kindle that I also loved. This is purfect to slip into my purse so that I can read anywhere at any time. It doesn't have a back light but I use a small reading clip on light and it's perfect. I can't remember the last time I was so pleased with a purchase. I highly recommend this ... not just for its affordability ... but its size and features. I also bought a pretty blue print case so that I'm less likely to misplace this one!!
customer_reviews.author: Summurbreez

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted – easy to use and it doesn't strain my eyes
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted – easy to use and it doesn't strain my eyes. I check out books from the local library and they're instantly added to my Kindle. Small enough to stash in my purse and take with me anywhere, and the battery lasts forever. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: No power button, worse battery life than older Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I have one of the older generation Kindles with the power buttons and it makes me mad that Amazon removed that function because the battery life is definitely worse. I can go weeks without charging my old Kindle while maintaining the same reading time of up to two hours every day but this thing can go barely a week without a recharge on the same pace. Not a fan of all the integrations with Goodreads and all the other sites either. Amazon should have just kept the basic functionality of the older generation while making this more aesthetically pleasing. Why fix what wasn't broken?
customer_reviews.author: Jan G.

customer_reviews.title: Strictly an e-reader! Great value as an e reader. Recommend using with nu-pro case.
customer_reviews.text: FYI This is strictly an e reader. The size is that of a pocketbook but thin like a magazine. Other reviews have complained of the placement of the power button. I compensated for this by reading in landscape mode. No problem, but it is a design flaw. I now use the nu- pro case and it protects the button from accidental use. Great price if only looking for an e reader. Ads are only showing like a screensaver at power up and don't interfere with readability.
customer_reviews.author: Grannyof10

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for book die-hards
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have any interest in e-readers, but my boyfriend gave me a 2nd generation Kindle as a college graduation present...that was 7.5 years ago. Eventually, I married that boyfriend, we had a son, and my baby stole my Kindle and broke it. I LOVED that Kindle and was freaking out about finding something that would give me the authentic book-reading experience I had enjoyed for more than 7 years. I am so glad I found this Kindle, it feels just like reading a book. I love how easy it is to turn the pages and increase or decrease font. I hope this lasts for many years!
customer_reviews.author: baltimoremama3324

customer_reviews.title: Shutting down in first 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The kindle itself is fine, I ordered to to replace a 10 year old Nook that keeps going on the fritz. Don't like how sensitive the touch screen is, any little brush brings up the font option or settings. The main reason I'm returning it is that it has shut down on me twice while reading a book...it will be charged but have the battery symbol on the screen and won't turn on without the hard reset. I feel like 3 weeks is way to soon for this to be happening, so it's on its way back to Amazon. Maybe I got a fluke, but I'd like to finish a book without battery issues.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Quality not as good as the earlier kindles..dissappointed 😔
customer_reviews.text: I was upgrading from the kindle I have I think 2nd OR 3rd gen with keyboard at the bottom.. i have been looking forward to the new smaller paperwhite. I got it just barely 4 weeks ago and only have used it a handful of times as I have been busy with company, work and christmas shopping and it already has 2 black spots inbthe center of the screen 1 looks like an apostrophe the other similar to a hashtag sign. As long as i havew had my 3rd gen kindle no blemishes at all on the screen. Considering returning and just use my old one. So disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: twyatt

customer_reviews.title: This was my third Kindle so I really do like the product
customer_reviews.text: This was my third Kindle so I really do like the product. The first 2 older models I gave to relatives and they still work. This one however only lasted 8 months and has now died. You don't expect electronics to last forever and chances are good I just kind the odd lemon, but still, I have to give it a poor rating based on its longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Gift Card Recipient

customer_reviews.title: Kindle white paper
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the new kindle white paper. I'm used to the old kindle, where you press buttons to "turn the page or turn back the page. I don't like the way it is set up to access ordering a new book: I just don't like it at all. My son, who is an IT tech said I should send it back, he had a hard time deciphering it. I also hate the protective case - the kindle just falls out of it. I also purchased the DVD Fleetwood Mac The Dance, a few weeks back. I was disappointed to not have any information about the songs and some info about the artists.
customer_reviews.author: Judie Ketterer

customer_reviews.title: Quick replacement for a defective one
customer_reviews.text: I've owned five or so Kindle e-readers. I bought a white one for the family which we used for about a week when the battery died. Charging it up took forever and it didn't last long. Next charge never took and it was dead after that. Amazon sent a replacement that arrived in a couple of days and I sent the dead one back in the new box. No hassle. New one works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad, but small
customer_reviews.text: Some nice features. The kindle I got was my first. It was quite a bit smaller than I thought it would be! But the font size is adjustable and seems fine in its default. I like the text reading feature, though it’s fairly robotic and a bit clunky when switching pages. It’s a nice feature to have it you’d like to close your eyes and be read to. It took a little bit getting used to since I’m mostly iOS and have been from the get go. But the e-ink is the whole reason I wanted it, I got it refurbished and at a good price, so I’m happy
customer_reviews.author: B. Brady

customer_reviews.title: There is no background light on this model. Read the description more carefully than I did.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I like to read inside, outside, and in the car. It is a basic model with no bells and whistles, nor a light. I should have read the description more thoroughly. I was offered the opportunity to exchange, but that was not an easy task for an old lady who is basically housebound. For the price I paid it is very good. Works well. I read outside and in the car while sitting in parking lots on the occasions when I feel like an adventure. I still need to use my Kindle to read indoors because of the lack of a background light, but every day can't be a Sunday.
customer_reviews.author: Annajustmay

customer_reviews.title: ... it is now touch screen and that isnt as good as having the page buttons on the side
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my girlfriend and she loves it just as she did the last Kindle BUT it is now touch screen and that isnt as good as having the page buttons on the side. I know touch screen is probably pitched as a better option but most people like the bottons instead, bring back the buttons! :)
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: 3rd time's a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd kindle. The first one was sat upon, and the 2nd one just froze up and never recovered. They were both kindle keyboards, which I loved for their size and the text-to-speech. So I was a bit bummed about having to get a different model this time around. But I am pleased as punch with it, and actually love the small size. It fits into a coat pocket and takes up very little space. I paired it with a brown faix leather case and it looks great. If you read anything other than Facebook posts in your spare time, then this is a must-have.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No light!
customer_reviews.text: My bad. I was so eager to read my books again when I lost my Kindle Fire, that I didn't read the details on this. It's a great size, easy to handle too. But there is no freaking backlight! WTF! I work all day, so my reading is usually at night, in bed. I don't want my room lit up like Wrigley Field to read a book. I'm spoiled. I want to adjust the backlight sp I can have a soft glow on the page. Too bad. This little bookie is taking a Very long nap in a box. I ordered az nother Fire so I could read.
customer_reviews.author: MimiDi

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed. The border seems to be the only place ...
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed. The border seems to be the only place to touch this Kindle without a change happening. The border is very narrow which makes the device hard to hold. If my fingers slip over the edge I will get a new page or a previous page or the dictionary or the letters will enlarge or get smaller, etc. I do like some of the features such as searching for a book and the length of the battery life and the lighter weight. However, I have gone back to my older model which changes pages only when I press a button on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy camper, Amazon
customer_reviews.text: If this reader had been my only example of Kindle, I would have gotten a Nook. I don't care for the format but that's a personal thing. It has to have a light directly over the screen to be able to read. Mostly it sits beside the computer to collect books & download to my old Kindle. I thought it would be easier to carry it with me when I went for radiation & chemo but no. Not a happy camper, Amazon ! It's battery life is much longer but I think that might have to do with the fact that it doesn't get used.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Wanted!
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months of owning my new white Kindle, I feel it is time for my honest review. I started my Kindle journey with one of the original Kindle Fires. After years of use, (even though I'm just 19) my eyes just couldn't take reading on the LED screen anymore. I shopped around and picked up this kindle on sale $50! One of the best things I've bought on this site. Pros: Amazing battery life, super crisp screen, easy to navigate menus, and built in Bluetooth for audio books. Cons: The only thing I wish this Kindle had was a microSD slot... besides that, no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley R.

customer_reviews.title: Battery Fails to Charge after 20 months
customer_reviews.text: Useful device as long as it lasted, but the battery failed to take a charge after only 20 months of use. Also no backlight, so use in dimly lit or darken areas not possible. Was offered a 15% discount on a new device as a replacement, because sadly this device carries only a 12 month warranty from the first day of use. Unless of course we had purchased a protection plan or an extended warranty for extra cost at the time of the original purchase. So the $75 that was spent on this device originally is now effectively wasted. Why would we want to purchase another?
customer_reviews.author: Thorpus Mason

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love this Kindle
customer_reviews.text: Love This Kindle! I am a no frills person when it comes to kindles! The more frills (lights, adjustable, etc) the shorter the battery life!! I don’t mind reading by a light or using my clip on light! I have 3 kindles, Kindle Keyboard, Kindle Touch and Kindle 8th Generation and I use all of them. If I travel, I take my touch or keyboard kindles as they not only have WiFi but also 3g!! All my kindles have great crisp screens, fast reaction time, lightweight and very easy to hold for small hands like mine! The 8th Generation Kindle is a keeper! AMAZON PLEASE COME OUT WITH A NEWER NO LIGHTS KINDLE!!
customer_reviews.author: C. F. Rigby

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a specific trip. I've used the Kindle app on my iPad for a couple years. But wanted something smaller for travel. Was initially concerned about the size, but it turned out to be perfect. Easy to carry on a plane. Very readable as long as you have a light source. Page sizes are ideal. Navigating my library of books as well as navigating within a book is pretty easy and intuitive. Very happy with my purchase for the price. It's no more or no less than it needs to be: a book reader.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cline

customer_reviews.title: No screen brightness settings!
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this kindle for me for my birthday. This was the first kindle I have ever owned and was excited to get this product, but I ended up returning this kindle and exchanged it for the next model up. The main reason why I exchanged this kindle for a different model was due to the lack of screen brightness. This kindle had no settings for back light, meaning I would have to use a book light, bed side light or natural light to read. I enjoy reading in bed and wanted the option to adjust screen brightness if needed. The next kindle model up was an additional $30 and I felt like that was worth the price difference.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: incompatible... obsolete..  brick.
customer_reviews.text: do not waste your time buying this device. it is already becoming incompatible with kindle ebooks sold on amazon. once this trend starts, pretty soon all the publishers will only be making apps for the latest and greatest devices. amazon could have forced compliance with all platforms, but they are going for the easy buck rather than take care of their customers. i just bought this device a few months ago from amazon and already running into ebooks that are not compatible. sorry business practice. even microsoft forced backward compatibility, for heaven's sake. would have never bought this device had i known of the compatibility morass.
customer_reviews.author: gw

customer_reviews.title: It's ok..
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good beginner E-reader. But the lack of a backlight made it hard to not upgrade to the paperwhite or oasis. Text is ok, better when zoomed in, forget reading in any type of low light situations as this screen does require a very good amount of light. It is NOT "anti-glare", if you hold it at certain angles whether indoor or outdoors it will have a good amount of glare. It can be a bit slow at times when loading different menu options. Overall this is not that bad of a product, BUT i would definitely recommend buying a paperwhite or oasis instead. Faster processors, backlight screens, better resolution screens and water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Some of my items are hidden from view.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a much older kindle that "died". I very much like the touch screen. It will take a little time for it to become intuitive but I'm sure when it does I will like it very much. I'm still having trouble finding some of the items I was used to on the older Kindle--bookmarks, underlining, dictionary, and speech--but I'm sure I will if I just sit down and work with the device. In the mean time I"m enjoying whipping through my newest books.
customer_reviews.author: Art Lady

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: This thing freezes and locks up constantly. When it does work, the screen flashes with each page turn. It tries to sell you things constantly. Basically, it worked well for a bit and then completely stopped being usable. I read the articles saying that you should hold the power button down for a while and that does nothing. If I do get it unfrozen through a series of charging, holding the button down, praying to the ancient gods of frustration and blood letting, it works for a day or two and locks up again. Horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Battery two week charge with no use
customer_reviews.text: I had the battery fully charged and turned off screen as suggested to turn off the unit. I have been sick for a week so the kindle has had no use. I just looked at it and battery is at half charge. I like the kindle but it looks like it will need a charge every other day with minimal use. What happens when I take it away from home to read and want to read for four hours? I like the kindle but I have serious concerns over this battery.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Short life. Bad battery. Dead Kindle. Disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size but the battery life was short. There were ads always on the cover when the protective case was opened and that may be why the battery would die even when it was not in use. After only one year it is completely dead and will not open even when it is on a charger. The photo shows it in its permanent failure state. I am back to using my very old busted up original kindle. I don’t think I read more than a couple of books on the new one.
customer_reviews.author: John Garner

customer_reviews.title: Refurb=Defective
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for six months and then it froze. Amazon replaced it with another Kindle and that one froze within 3 months. No replacement or refund offered because by that time the warranty was up. It was not renewed with the replacement. Now I’m stuck with a device that doesn’t work and a 15% coupon for another Kindle because after all of that I really want to waste my money again. Thanks, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier!!!
customer_reviews.text: I debated back and forth about whether or not to buy the original Kindle or the Paperwhite version. the main difference that was my struggle was whether or not I wanted a backlit screen. I went with the original and have not regretted my decision at all/ I actually much prefer the real book look it has. if I want to read in bed I have a book light! it has been something that goes everywhere with me since the day it arrived. the availability to sync it with my audible library is a huge bonus. I am so happy that I finally broke down and bought one!!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this device. It is used but arrive in great condition. The screen is easy to read and reduces eye strain compared to reading an a tablet. My only issue is that the device was not properly prepared for me to use it. For some reason it would not clear out the previous owner and had to be done by Amazon after a long process
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some changes good, some bad
customer_reviews.text: My major complaint with this Kindle is the lack of buttons to turn the pages. My old Kindle had buttons. This unit has a touch screen. That's all right except that there is not enough casing on the sides of the case to prevent frequent accidentally turned pages because the screen was touched. I love the dictionary function. It's very convenient. But, this Kindle does not fit my hand as ergonomically as my old one did. All in all, I'd say there are more negatives in the design change than positive ones.
customer_reviews.author: The Troll Under the Bridge

customer_reviews.title: A good but not great reader
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several Kindle readers. I got this oner to replace an older one that broke (my fault). It is the first KIndle reader that I've owned with a touch screen. The text is nice and clear and the page changes are quick, but the user interface is confusing. Because the screen is sensitive, sometimes I find that I've moved forward or backward without intending to. And once in a while when I turn it on the screen comes up with a different-size font, humongous, and I have to reset the font size. Sometimes newer is not better. But It is good enough so that I don't feel that I have to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Sonoma Geezer

customer_reviews.title: The battery won't charge
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Kindle since early April. I had an older model so it took me a while to get used to this one. I didn't use it for about a month and of course it needed to be charged. When I tried to charge it yesterday, the light turned green after a few hours, but it won't open. The symbol of a battery with an exclamation point is all I see on the screen. I charged it directly from the wall plug, not the computer. This was a refurbished Kindle so I knew I was taking a chance on getting very much life out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Battery just failed after 1 year following moderate use
customer_reviews.text: Would highly recommend that you DO NOT to buy this kindle. Just 1 month after the 1 year warranty expired (perfect timing) the battery failed and the kindle will now only hold a charge for <30 min. Despite a number of calls to Amazon including their tech support their only solution was a 15% discount to buy a new Kindle! We used this Kindle very sparingly and to have to have it fail so quickly was very disappointing to put it mildly. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Harris

customer_reviews.title: I didn't think I would like this Kindle as much as I do
customer_reviews.text: I have another Kindle that became obsolete because I didn't have WiFi at the time and couldn't download updates. I wanted to try an inexpensive replacement. This Kindle is lightweight - a wonderful improvement over the iPad I was using. My favorite thing is the built in dictionary. I read some very well educated authors and it's fantastic to be able to touch the word I'm not sure of and get the definition, immediately. Now I have all of my books on one E-reader. I can save precious space on the iPad for photos. It charged so quickly and my books transferred quickly as well. I bought the Paperwhite with ads. They're easily ignored. I'd recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Magda Dream

customer_reviews.title: Made my headaches go away!
customer_reviews.text: I had a kindle fire for years it finally stopped working so I got this instead. I had been reading on my phone and it was making my eyes hurt and giving me headaches. So I decided on the paperwhite because it doesn't have a light so it's like reading a book which doesnt hurt your eyes or give you a headache. I call it my feather book because it looks like the pages of a book and you need a lamp like an actual book but it's very light and you dont have to hold the other side of pages down.
customer_reviews.author: RoWe

customer_reviews.title: so I'm still learning how to navigate it but I really love having so many books available in such a small ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not the most tech-savvy person, so I'm still learning how to navigate it but I really love having so many books available in such a small package! I take it on hiking trips, and it's pretty durable -- I've dropped it more than once; no damage.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Morgan

customer_reviews.title: doesn't come with any instructions
customer_reviews.text: disliked the fact that i was not allowed to add it as a 'gift' so it shows it belongs to me instead of the birthday present i sent to my son neither one of them have any 'computer logic' the reader showed it ' BELONGS TO ME' so he was constantly calling me to ask questions he lives about 100 miles from me so helping him is a problem for me since i am confined to a wheelchair going up to his house is impossible for me
customer_reviews.author: dorothy aspegren

customer_reviews.title: Dead and unrechargeable battery after 1 month and no access to support from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the product 30 days and the battery is dead. It won't recharge (I've tried multiple wires, chargers and outlets) and there is just a "!" on the main screen. I've looked up order on Amazon and my opportunity for support or to return has expired. Poor service from Amazon. There are many competing products so, I guess I'll change to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: A Perry

customer_reviews.title: Replacement Kindle
customer_reviews.text: This one replaces an old model two that finally bit the dust. Thinner lighter. My old one held a charge for about a month with reading 2-3 hours a night. This one only holds a charge for about a week. The font size is better; the old one had step sizes this one has a slider, however after 10 pages or so the size starts to slip and needs resetting (easily reset just annoying). The bottom adjacent to the on/off button is soft and some times my holding it will turn it off or on.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mire

customer_reviews.title: Love It Great Birthday Gift from Husband
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on Thursday as Amazon said it would. Easy to use and lightweight. I like how I can carry it along with me in my coat pocket and the special features even makes more special to me. Worth what I paid for it. Described as the seller described it. It was birthday gift for me from husband. Best birthday gift that I can use instead of sitting on a shelf collecting dust. What I like about it most it keeps charged longer no need to charge it every four hours. Thanks Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with library downloads!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very displeased with this product. For some time now I have been trying to load books at home from my local library. When I couldn't load the books repeatedly, I thought it was a library problem. When I went to the library, the librarian determined that the problem is, in fact, the Kindle E-reader. It does not interface with Overdrive nor with Freading. It only works with Hoopla. This is very disappointing and I would not buy this product for that reason. I would like to return it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Nolen

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfaction.
customer_reviews.text: This Kind This Kindle downloads books more quickly than my old one. However the touch screen often skips a page with only one tap. However, the major problem is the battery life is practically nonexistent. It was fair for about 2 months, now it drains constantly, even when not in use. It can go from 100% to 0% in 3 hours and I haven't read a word. Phone assistance is prompt, but while a factory reset apparently did not work I must now return the device, either for repair or replacement In short, DON't purchase this model.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Fan
customer_reviews.text: I really like having a kindle. It's great to be able to read outside without glare and it's very dependable. I got this one as a back up for my paperwhite version, and also to try audible. I didn't realize you need to have bluetooth earbuds or speaker to access audible, but since getting bluetooth I'm enjoying audible..
customer_reviews.author: jg

customer_reviews.title: Constantly turning off
customer_reviews.text: If this is the new and improved version of the Kindle e-reader, then the designer should be fired. Putting the power button on the bottom where I accidentally turn it off every time I sit down to read (usually multiple times) makes my reading experience more frustrating than if I'd stuck with the old-fashioned book. The simple solution is to put it on the top of the reader where I can easily access it, but won't accidentally press it. In retrospect, I wish I had purchased an older model in which the power button wasn't so easy to press.
customer_reviews.author: J and S Berg

customer_reviews.title: Returned it
customer_reviews.text: Very faint or faded screen which cannot be seen at all in a darkened room. Screen is not white ;it is some sickly creme or something. Not intuitive at all. I found it difficult to even find the book I was reading because the screen was full of ads for books. When turning a page, the screen blinks or flashes to a split second before settling down. Very very disappointed. Wish my old Kindle Fire had not stopped working. Don't know what to buy now. I only want to read but the Paperwhite doesn't interest me. I almost never read underwater anymore. I don't care to be read to and I don't want Alexa or anyone else talking to me.
customer_reviews.author: mrbill

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have always been an avid reader, I love holding the book in my hands, turning the pages and the smell of the books. when my friend first suggested for me to get a Kindle I said, heck NO!! But he loaned me his (with much persistance), so I gave in and read a few books on his Kindle. I have to say, I really enjoyed it. So I broke down and bought myself one, and I love it, I bought a beautiful cover for it, it is easy to use, simple instructions and so forth. It is convenient, reliable, and small enough to fit in my purse. I would diffidently recommend this to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s supposed to but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure it’ll get easier but at the moment everything is a fight. I don’t like the way it displays the library. It puts up three books then fills the rest with “based on your reading” suggestions. I don’t need help in deciding what I wish to read, thank you very much. So you get in and get 6 books. The movement isn’t smooth and sometimes doesn’t wish to go. On the plus side I like to read outside and the iPad is impossible. Going back more than one or two pages is difficult, the iPad is MUCH easier. I’ll keep using it but I can’t say I’d ever buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great little reader for incredible price
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever!! I read like a crazy person, I am a remarkably fast reader, and finish books really quickly. My old Kindle died with 450+ books on it and I was really unhappy. This simple little Kindle was so cheap, but as fantastic in quality as the expensive ones I have had over the years. If you just need a simple reader, without any bells and whistles like the Fire and Paper White, with a very limited budget like mine, this is what you need. I love it! Please note, this picture shows my Kindle with a cover I purchased. It was only $10 here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Colliemom 3

customer_reviews.title: I had Paperwhite but returned it as the backlight wasn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I had Paperwhite but returned it as the backlight wasn't uniform. The led emitted light from the edge of the screen which reminiscint of the old Nokia phone. Besides, you shouldn't be reading in the dark. I feel this is more practical and I just want to be able to read on planes and travel as if I had a book.
customer_reviews.author: Harry K

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I had an early edition kindle for many many years. Loved it. However over time it felt to hold a charge like it used to. So I decided to upgrade. Worst decision ever. I’ve had issues with this kindle since I bought it. Has never been able to hold a charge for more than a few hours. Very disappointed in what was otherwise a favorite and much recommended item.
customer_reviews.author: Bookgirl455a

customer_reviews.title: lack of information with this kindle
customer_reviews.text: i almost sent this back a second time because i had no idea how to use it- this was completely different than my old one- i was on you tube and google trying to find info to work this kindle- i notice the UK kindle comes with a quick start guide included- why can't you include a small sheet on how to start up and what the symbols mean- i have this over a month and i'm still not comfortable with it- if my old one was still working i would have kept it- technology is not always an improvement jan
customer_reviews.author: Janice Porcelli

customer_reviews.title: Not an improvement over the last model
customer_reviews.text: I loved my older Kindle, with actual tabs to turn the page. The new one, with its touch screen, is no improvement. It's too easy to accidentally turn the page (or several pages, losing your place) by tapping the screen in error. When you turn the page you also have to be very careful to tap in the right place lest you accidentally go to a footnote instead. It's particularly difficult to get all this right if you're holding the Kindle in one hand. I wish they had kept the physical tabs on the sides, and kept the price down where it was as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it, one bitch
customer_reviews.text: We received this as a gift from our daughter and it works great. Complaints: 1) The "Device Info" screen does not list model. Once this is liberated from its packaging you are left with model SY69JL etched the back. The Kindle product naming structure is poor. Searching on SY69JL returns a few hits, all for covers. 2) The cover our daughter also gifted us was the wrong size due to this bad model naming structure I suspect. It took me longer than needed to find a cover I was confident would fit. Also, this takes a bit more ambient light than a book. If I bought one I'd spend more to get one that has backlighting.
customer_reviews.author: L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: I love reading outside again!
customer_reviews.text: This little device is light, and the battery lasts for weeks on end. I find myself reading more now because this is so easy to carry around with me. It easily fits in a jacket pocket or in my work bag. The best thing, though, is how easy it is to read OUTSIDE in direct sunlight! Nothing is better than sitting under a tree on a beautiful afternoon and just reading a fun book. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: rendering it useless. Followed all the troubleshooting tips
customer_reviews.text: This version of the kindle is a complete lemon. It is impossible to keep the battery charged, rendering it useless. Followed all the troubleshooting tips, it's obviously a known problem with this model, but none of the troubleshooting tips work. The old version of the kindle kept a charge for a very long time even with frequent use. This one will lose its charge within a day with no use. You basically have to keep it plugged in to read. Do not buy unless you want an expensive paperweight!
customer_reviews.author: JHL

customer_reviews.title: Worth it if you like reading.
customer_reviews.text: If you are wondering why would I get this if I can just download the app on my phone? I would recommend purchasing this cheaper e reader and deciding if it's worth it. I personally love it. It's like a thousand books at your fingertips. No distractions from Facebook, texts, emails, or calls. It actually feels like you are reading a book. Get the cover that goes with it and make sure the cover fits properly because they change the Kindle size ever do slightly with each generation.
customer_reviews.author: bjfield85

customer_reviews.title: Not lighted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Kindle three years ago. It's still in its box, inside its plastic wrapping, because I learned that it is not lighted before I opened it. My two main reasons for having a Kindle are convenience and light. The light may be the most important. I was sick of trying to find places to plug in external booklights, trying to get them to stay in place, trying to read by their miserable misdirected light. Kindle is perfect for my needs, But not this one: it's just an annoyance--not even heavy enough to be a booklight.
customer_reviews.author: Lori L

customer_reviews.title: Great e-ink reader.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reader for anyone who doesn't like reading from a backlit surface. Backlit readers give me migraines, and I can only use e-ink readers. This one fits all of my needs perfectly. I can read it anywhere, including in direct sunlight. All you need is the same lighting you'd have for a regular book. It came pre-programmed with my Amazon account, and was super easy to load my library to. It was also easy to hook up to my desktop, and load my books from there also. It's a great choice for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CountableZero

customer_reviews.title: Back to basics.
customer_reviews.text: With all of the terrific tablets and Kindle Fires available, I had forgotten how wonderful simplicity can be. My Kindle Fire finally died after years of faithful service and I needed a replacement. I thought about my first generation Kindle with fondness and decided to order this one. The amazing battery life was a big factor in my decision. I have not been disappointed!! The light weight of it took some getting used to but I am really pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi Smith

customer_reviews.title: Danger:  this product is not satisfying if used for reading.
customer_reviews.text: i was extremely disappointed in the Kindle Paperwhite. Whenever I picked up the Kindle, it was difficult to find my place. No sooner than I began to read, the screen flashed on and off several times. Some of those flashes were followed by a reboot, all of which were aggravating when I wanted to read. Another ittitating point for me was the peddling of book, other readers’ opinions or underlinings, and other book recommendations. I have used every new iteration Kindle and have enjoyed each one. In my opinion, this model fails on all counts. I will put in in the drawer and go back to my last Kindle or even the old fashioned book.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I loved my first Kindle and it lasted a long time. It charged easily and quickly and was light enough to carry in my purse so I always had something to read. I ordered this as a replacement. IT IS VERY LOW QUALITY AND A TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT. It stopped working after 9 months and amazon.com was completely unhelpful. I am now using my iPad to read Kindle items. I WILL NEVER PURCHASE ANOTHER KINDLE BECAUSE THE QUALITY IS SO POOR AND AMAZON WILL NOT FIX OR HELP.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: Can't make groupings like in the older versions
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awful. Can't make groupings like in the older versions, doesn't have buttons on the side (hard to see in pictures so I honestly did not know). I will be buying the old edition again and hoping they will revert back at some point.
customer_reviews.author: mrsthevamp

customer_reviews.title: Class of 2017
customer_reviews.text: I said I would never buy a Kindle as I love eal books too much. A friend told me about the E-Reader 8th Generation. This is a prize!!!!! As I read it mostly at night in bed - it's perfect. So light weight, its a pleasure to hold. I also like the fact that this one comes without a light in it. That totally suited me as I like to read by my bedside lamp and the pages on the E-Reader are so easy on the eyes and no glare - it's wonderful!!!!!!! I recommend this item - a great gift idea for yourself or someone you want to see smile ... !!!! B R-W
customer_reviews.author: Barb W

customer_reviews.title: 16 Months Old, and Dead.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Kindle 16 months ago to replace one that I lost. I didn't use it often, and took really good care of it. When I went to use it today, it was totally dead. Since it's 4 months out of warranty (I've had it for only 16 months!), Amazon offered me 15% off of a new device. This is the second Kindle I've had fail at less than a year and a half old. I've had three of these devices, but will never again purchase any. Amazon's customer service and appreciation is woefully lacking since their response was basically, these things fail *shrug*!
customer_reviews.author: DnA

customer_reviews.title: Best electronic reading experience ever!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Christmas this year (2017) and I love it! Very easy to read in normal lighting, even easier to read in bright sunshine! If you're reading in dim light, it can be hard to see, but there are plenty of LED reading lights that can be used on this for those situations. It has recently updated (Jan 6, 2018) and now you can listen to audible books on it through a bluetooth connected headset. I haven't tried this yet, but for those interested, yes it can be done.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wells

customer_reviews.title: bought it, but hate it
customer_reviews.text: I love my kindle books but I hate this reader in that i have to tap it for the next page. Some times it takes numerous taps before it'lll move. Also don't like that it doesn't allow me to go to end of books when they end early and have previews of other books which I could care less about reading.
customer_reviews.author: jei

customer_reviews.title: Where is the "Build your vocabulary?"
customer_reviews.text: I do not see this feature on my e-reader. According to some of the comments, I go to menu and click on build your vocabulary. I do not have a menu option on my e-reader. What is strange is that I have a 'goodread' option. Anyone know why? I Build your vocabulary Words looked up in the dictionary are automatically added to Vocabulary Builder to expand your knowledge and reinforce retention. Swipe through your vocabulary words, quiz yourself with flashcards, and instantly see those words in context.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost the best buy done!
customer_reviews.text: I simply love Amazon devices. This e-reader is easy to work with and use. Goodreads integration, vocabulary builder, audiobooks support through Bluetooth and decent storage for a few audiobooks at the time. You can adjust everything and make it easier for you to read. It is small and I usually lose it in my backpack. I love the color and the shape and how it feels in my hands. The battery live is really good it lasts for weeks without use and for a couple of weeks using it, and a week in heavy use! (I have been using it like crazy!) For the price and all you get from this, it is a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Inkish Kingdoms

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed in my Kindle E-reader
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in my Kindle E-reader. It is not user-friendly. I had a first generation Kindle that was far more user-friendly, but it wore out. I also have a Kindle Fire that is more user-friendly than my new E-reader, but not as good as my original first generation Kindle. Simple is better.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brownlee

customer_reviews.title: Rather Slow
customer_reviews.text: It is a used product, so we didn't expect too too much. Got it so we can take it on the go without having to worry about damaging a tablet or books or anything. It was kind of a pain in the booty to get together and has a couple little bugs here and there, but overall it's a good little reader for what we needed it for. I do appreciate that it came with a cable as well. Will update this if anything changes!
customer_reviews.author: D. Moreau

customer_reviews.title: Elegant library
customer_reviews.text: This small device carries my whole library. I like to read books and carrying them all takes a huge space while travelling. Also living in a small home cannot accommodate too many stuffs. This kindle is the worthy every penny I paid. I feel the paperwhite is not worth the money as all it takes is to turn on the lights and read. It is the lightest and most comfortable to hold. Looks elegant. I carry it with me all the time. I keep books, magazines and whatever, PDF files. Its easy to read whatever I feel like. The interface is same as 7th generation. The look is slightly different from the last gen kindle. It looks yet more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Bidzi

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Kindle E-reader - White. I do wish I had ordered the one that is back lit but, oh well. I haven't been able to figure out how to move the books that I purchased on my old Kindle to the new Kindle but I am hoping there is a way.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: I quit using it far inferior to old button kindle
customer_reviews.text: I have used my old kindle with buttons for about 10 years. I loved it. I read hundreds of books on it. But then it quit, so I bought this new paper white kindle. It is so disappointing, very difficult to navigate. The dictionary difficult to use. It is worse than my old kindle in every way. I have quit using it and now read on my Galaxy tablet which is also difficult to navigate but not as bad. Hard to find your place. I would buy an upgraded kindle, but I am thinking that all the new ones have the same navigation issues.
customer_reviews.author: M. Konikoff

customer_reviews.title: I like it much more than my Kindle Fire 7
customer_reviews.text: I like it much more than my Kindle Fire 7, however I have to say I like my old plain Kindle Reader that I had for several years even better. I'm sure I will adjust and get used to my newer Kindle Reader which is more than I can say about my Kindle Fire 7. All in all they are good products but I am old and just want to read on them, don't need the extra stuff and the easier to use the better.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: As an owner of the first model that came out, I have been an excellent advocate of Kindle E-reader. This one however was extremely unsatisfactory. The pages turn all the time without any prompt. Or when I do want to turn a page I can't, without several tries. Quite often I'm not able to bring down the menu at the top. I would like another Kindle: however, I don't want to waste my money again. .
customer_reviews.author: mamtelli

customer_reviews.title: I miss the back light!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after losing my Paperwhite version on an airline. I love everything about it, except that I miss the light! I can't read in the dark anymore! I will admit that the unlit display is beautiful in bright sunlight and anywhere your lighting isn't shadowy. The battery life is amazing, I have only charged it once since Christmas and it's almost February. It feels lighter than the paperwhite version which is easier on your hands during long reading sessions. Even without the light, it's a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Circuits

customer_reviews.title: Clearly this was made with young people in mind
customer_reviews.text: As a older reader, I have lots of time to read and enjoy books. Unfortunately, my hands shake so the touch screen is hard to maneuver for me but I'm getting used to it. The Library is great now that I know how to use it but the print on the Library page is very small and even with glasses is hard to read, especially at night. This particular Kindle is a new style for me. I really loved the Kindle Keyboard but obviously progress marches on and so must I. On the whole, well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: NM Reader

customer_reviews.title: Simple and works. Just like I want
customer_reviews.text: I like that this doesn't have Alexa or any of that other fancy crap. Also, don't have to worry about blue light filters or having a hard time going to sleep because there is not back light. Haven't broken it yet despite one good drop. The one thing I want is for the screen to just turn off when I turn it off. I know the screen uses almost zero batteries and sometimes the screen saver does recommend a good book but I just feel like it is advertising to me when every I notice it sitting on the end table. Why can't the screen just go off? Is there a setting for that somewhere?
customer_reviews.author: Ambcurt

customer_reviews.title: Not clear how to connect to Blue Tooth
customer_reviews.text: This device did not connect to my blue tooth earphones, which I bought 2 months ago. I spent 2 hours on the computer and phone before fifth agent said my JWC earphones don't work with the Kindle. When I asked which do, she did not know or would not say. I have spent an hour trying to figure this out . MAYBE they only need to be A2DP compatible, but I thought all earphones were. Five 'experts' didn't know this at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: phillip gill

customer_reviews.title: 8th generation short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it is just bad luck, but I bought an 8th Gen Kindle May 6 2018; had to replace it May 19th; had to replace it October 28th; and just got a replacement order April 12. And the warranty doesn't reset, so if it breaks May 7 2019 I have to buy a new one. I used it almost every day, and I turn it on and off a lot. I've never dropped or spilled on it -- misty rain on the screen is the extent of trauma any of them have experienced. It's excellent functional design. But if it's $80 a year (or say 18 months) to own a basic kindle, it should be sold and advertised that way.
customer_reviews.author: Earthsophagus

customer_reviews.title: ... expired after MUCH use and one feature I did like on this one was the 'leather' cover with the ...
customer_reviews.text: This new Kindle is replacing one that expired after MUCH use and one feature I did like on this one was the 'leather' cover with the built in light. This new one is smaller and lighter which I like a lot. My only thought is that I wish it came with a little booklet as to the usage of all the little icons. There really are people out there who do not scroll and poke their phones and really do read manuals that accompany new products so the scrolling was a 'new' feature for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jane F. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Durable, simple and a pleasure to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in late 2016 for a deployment to Iraq. I threw a couple dozen books on it and spent countless hours reading the thing by red headlamp. When it wasn't in my hand it was in sandy cargo pockets, rubbing back and forth with the movement of walking and running, or bumbling around in a sandy patrol pack. The battery life is just incredible, I never had to worry about the thing dying on me, vital with occasionally spotty electricity availability. It lasted week and weeks. As you can see form the photos the body has held up amazingly through this all. It's rough but totally functioning, same as the day I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Al D.

customer_reviews.title: Less than a year old, and I'm getting an "Invalid battery" error.
customer_reviews.text: It's been lightly used, never dropped, and it's less than a year old. Suddenly we go to power it on and there's an error saying we need to contact Amazon support for a -22 Invalid Battery error. By lightly used, I might less than 6 hours per week. It's treated gently as we don't want to break it since it feels kind of delicate. No cracks, no knicks, no scratches. Suddenly it doesn't want to work. Reaching out to support for help.
customer_reviews.author: Echo November

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy kindle but I was not sure if I would really like reading books using kindle. Here are my pros and cons. Pros I like the screen without light to avoid eye strains. The touchscreen is very sensitive which I like. The device is lightweight. It plays the audible (missing function of kindle white). Cons The only function I think it is missing is it does not play audible while reading the book (kindle app can do this). Overall, it is a good device. It was one of the best purchases that I made recently. I read books a lot more than I used to.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love my Kindle! Premature battery warning screen?
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE Kindle! A few months ago I upgraded so that I could also listen to my 20 years of Audible books and not have to also bring my iPad. Everything works great. Two months ago I got a battery low screen. A few weeks later I got another one. I'm thinking, this thing is supposed to last for months, right. So I replaced the charging cord with a new Amazon Basics cord. Next I switched the charger with a known good one (my iPhone charger.) Today it has the low battery screen again. I've had the Kindle for four and 1/2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde O. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: My old, "unimproved" Kindle offered a far better reading experience
customer_reviews.text: The hypersensitive touchscreen of this "improved" Kindle frequently interrupts my reading with definitions, footnotes &/or highlighting that simply materialize, even though I don't want and didn't intend to activate any of these functions. This near-constant intrusiveness badly degrades the pleasure of reading. Adverts also more intrusive now. Have tried, without success so far, to figure out how to turn off these bells & whistles. Had the battery on my wonderfully simple older Kindle not died, I'd still be using that device with far more pleasure than this misconceived "upgrade" offers. Sometimes, more really is less.
customer_reviews.author: WL

product_meta.title: Kindle E-reader (Previous Generation - 8th) - White, 6" Display, Wi-Fi, Built-In Audible - Includes Special Offers
feature_bullets: All-new design is thinner and lighter, and now available in your choice of black or white.
With Audible built in, access the world’s largest library of audiobooks. Easily switch between reading and listening on Bluetooth-enabled speakers or headphones.
Easy on your eyes—touchscreen display reads like real paper.
No screen glare, even in bright sunlight, unlike tablets.
Keep reading—a single charge lasts weeks, not hours.
Get lost in your story with no alerts or notifications.
Instant access to new releases and bestsellers, or from over a million titles at $2.99 or less. Prime members read free with unlimited access to over a thousand titles.
Looking for a light? Try Kindle Paperwhite.
